sub_title: Senior Associate Tax Reporting & Strategy at PwC | Finance Director at Turing Society Netherlands
summary: Working in the Tax Reporting & Strategy practice of PwC Netherlands, focusing on Tax Technology. In 2017 and 2018, I was shortlisted back-to-back as one of the Netherlands leading breakout talents under 26 in the Dutch digital scene by The Next Web (TNW). Next to my work at PwC, I am the Finance Director of the Dutch activities of Turing Society, a social business that creates a complete tech education ecosystem with the goal to educate world's next generation of top coders.

awards.title: Shortlisted on The Next Web (TNW) T500 list back-to-back for 2017 and 2018.
awards.description:
Shortlisted on The Next Web (TNW) T500 list back-to-back for 2017 and 2018. The T500 is the definitive list of the Netherlands' most inspiring under 26s across all fields of digital. Entrepreneurs, designers, coders, storytellers, academic researchers and more. 

The Next Web organizes Europe's biggest and award-winning technology conference.

https://thenextweb.com/conference/t500

awards.title: Honors Program Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences
awards.description:
The honors graduate distinguishes himself as an innovative professional who demonstrates development on the following competences:

1. Innovation driven
2. Demand driven
3. Collaborative working
4. Interactive learning
5. Knowledge creation

awards.title: HBO Financial Talent Award 2015, 2nd place
awards.description:
Financial Talent Award 2015:  The case competition for finance students of Dutch and Flemish universities of applied sciences.

✪ Result: 2nd (of 32 teams).

awards.title: Global Family Enterprise Case Competition 2015, 3rd in division
awards.description:
Representing Rotterdam University of Applied Science, as a consultant-competitor for the 3rd annual Global Family Enterprise Case Competition held by the University of Vermont. A family business case competition with participating universities from 13 different countries.

✪ Became third in the division.

awards.title: NIBS Worldwide Business Plan Competition 2014, 4th place
awards.description:
The NIBS Worldwide Business Plan Competition aims to stimulate entrepreneurship among students. Teams are challenged to conceive of a new service or product offering, and then create a business plan and concept pitch video aimed at convincing potential investors to finance the business. 

✪ Result: 4th place in this international competition.
awards.issuer: The Network of International Business Schools (NIBS)

projects.title: Zurich Model United Nations International Telecommunications Union Delegate
projects.description:
Zurich Model United Nations (ZuMUN) is an organization that aspires to offer a high-level debate that will help gain a deeper understanding of both the issues at hand and of how the international community is and could be working towards resolving them.

By multilateral approaches, the participants debate and tackle various global issues from the perspective of a delegate representing a member of the UN.

At the ZuMUN 2017 summit, I was a delegate in the International Telecommunications Union.  The over-arching conference theme was 'Brave New World - The Political and Socio-Economic Implications of the Digital Revolution'.

During the conference I debated about:
- Closing the Technology Gap between developed countries and least developed countries to help eradicate poverty.

During this event I Increased my intercultural skills as I worked together with global candidates in a spirit of international cooperation.

contributors.headline: Senior Associate Tax Reporting & Strategy at PwC | Finance Director at Turing Society Netherlands

projects.title: Participant in the Rotterdam100 24 Hour Creation Battle
projects.description:
The Rotterdam100 is a talent competition in which the most excellent students and young professionals work with leading companies and create innovative solutions for challenging business cases which are focused around the Next Economy.

During the 24 Hour Creation Battle we, our team, worked on a circular economy business innovation for Engie Netherlands.

contributors.headline: Senior Associate Tax Reporting & Strategy at PwC | Finance Director at Turing Society Netherlands

projects.title: Junior Tutor at International Tax Week 2014
projects.description:
I was a Junior Tutor at the 23rd annual International Tax Week in Grottammare, Italy.

The International Tax Week is an international event for undergraduate taxation students in Europe.

I tutored a group of twenty students from Germany, Italy, The Netherlands, Belgium and United Kingdom in International Tax Law during the week.

The group of students competed in a taxation case competition and I was co-responsible with another junior tutor for progress and I coached the group in solving the case.

profile_positions.title: Student Associate Tax Reporting & Strategy - Tax Technology focus

profile_positions.description:
•	I am responsible for the finance, tax and legal function of all the Dutch activities of this fast growing social enterprise in tech education, which includes two student teams in Rotterdam and Amsterdam.
•	Managed the implementation of a new legal structure which is suitable for the governance style and the growth of the nonprofit and for profit activities.

Turing Society is the first complete tech education ecosystem in the world. Our focus is the young and talented tech geniuses which with professional guidance can build themselves a great career in technology. To achieve this, we are continuously working to bring together the three pillars - technology, community and the future.
profile_positions.title: Finance Director Turing Society Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
The bootcamp is centered around weekly machine learning competitions in which students work in teams to develop models that solve real-world tasks.

The course teaches machine learning (ML), especially deep learning, and its applications in the world of finance. The course follows a buffet approach, meaning it gives an introduction to many subfields and shows you how you can dive in deeper.

After completing the course i have a solid understanding of the most important techniques and I am be able to build systems to tackle business and finance problems.
profile_positions.title: Graduate of the Machine Learning in a Financial Context Bootcamp

profile_positions.description:
• Turing Front End Bootcamp is a ten week long, problem-solving based, programming bootcamp in which I learned the fundamentals of Front End Web Development.

• Turing Back End Bootcamp is a eight week long, problem-solving based, programming bootcamp in which I learned the fundamentals of Back End Web Development.

The Turing Back End Bootcamp in combination with the Turing Front End Bootcamp transforms students into junior full stack developers. The curriculum focuses on teaching the Back End (SQL, PHP, Laravel), Front End (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery) and working in a team (Git, Agile, Pair Programming). Each week features intensive assignments and challenges designed to push the students to their limits and be inventive with their problem solving. The bootcamp aims to train students how to solve problems with the new tools it provides.
profile_positions.title: Graduate of the Turing Front End & Back End Bootcamps 2016/2017

profile_positions.description:
2Divorce Junior is a learn-work company at Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences. Juniors provide support activities for 2Divorce Franchise BV in the (after) care propositions for customers of the franchise. The fields covered are marketing, finance, commercial, non-profit activities and support customers in aftercare. These activities might include directing towards aid agencies, tax returns, supporting and Jobcare.

During my time studying at Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences, I had the privilege of working with highly motivated and like-minded students to build this learn-work company from the ground up.

I was responsible for the administrative organization:

• Managed the creation of internal control standards for this training company.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Internal Control

profile_positions.description:
I assisted international clients (mainly public interest entities), with a main focus on US based headquarters, with their tax compliance. 

My day to day work included: 
- Preparation of complex corporate income tax returns (standalone and fiscal unities); 

During my internship at PwC, I did comparative research for my undergraduate thesis on the co-operative compliance models of The Netherlands, United States of America, United Kingdom and Australia to gain insight in the way co-operative compliance models should be shaped.

Thesis result: 8.5 (85%)
